Line 5: Line 5:
In [http://www.heise.de/security/news/meldung/74980 July 2006] [http://www.heise-security.co.uk/ heise Security] was launched in the UK – mostly featuring translated news from the German site, but also locally relevant stories, the UK version of [http://www.heise-online.co.uk/ heise online] came in February 2008. Since June 2007 there also is a [http://www.heise-online.pl/ Polish heise online]
In [http://www.heise.de/security/news/meldung/74980 July 2006] [http://www.heise-security.co.uk/ heise Security] was launched in the UK – mostly featuring translated news from the German site, but also locally relevant stories, the UK version of [http://www.heise-online.co.uk/ heise online] came in February 2008. Since June 2007 there also is a [http://www.heise-online.pl/ Polish heise online]
â
[[hyperlink|Links]] from the Heise site can cause a massive increase in [[web traffic]] to the referenced sites and can cause some to become temporarily unavailable. While in the English speaking world this is known as the [[Slashdot effect]], among German speakers this is referred to as ''the Heise effect'', or arguably inappropriately, ''Heise-[[DDoS|Denial-of-service attack]]''.
+
[[hyperlink|Links]] from the Heise site can cause a massive increase in [[web traffic]] to the referenced sites and can cause some to become temporarily unavailable. While in the English speaking world this is known as the [[Slashdot effect]], among German speakers this is referred to as ''the Heise effect'', or arguably inappropriately, ''Heise-[[Denial-of-service attack|DDoS]]''.
